medical_history.chief_complaint: Dyspnea, wheezing, headaches, cough, and night sweats.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noted the onset of a cough producing thin yellow sputum approximately 5 months before this presentation. This was followed by exertional dyspnea, chest tightness, and wheezing. Ten days before this presentation, lethargy, myalgias, chills, headaches, anorexia, and night sweats developed. Nine days later, he presented to his primary care physician due to recurrent cough, night sweats, myalgia, and fatigue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Fibromyalgia diagnosed 6 years prior, history of lumbosacral disk protrusion at L5–S1, persistent right foot drop, carpal tunnel syndrome, knee osteoarthritis, cervical spondylosis, sleep apnea, and peptic ulcer disease.
medical_history.family_history: Father died from complications of type 2 diabetes mellitus at age 54; mother had hypothyroidism and died from acute leukemia at age 83; sister has systemic lupus erythematosus, scleroderma, and Hashimoto’s thyroiditis.
medical_history.social_history: The patient works in a health care facility and is exposed to multiple sick contacts. He drinks alcohol socially and smoked two packs of cigarettes per week during college. He has traveled to Florida 1 month before evaluation and to Europe and the Caribbean in the previous 8 months.
